Knowledge Point: This appendix gives an overview of the recorded 220 texts which form the basis for the present description of Papuan Malay (see also §\ref{Para_1.11.4} and §\ref{Para_1.11.5}). For each text the following information is provided:

\item[\rmfamily File name] For each text the name of the respective WAV file and Toolbox record is given. This name specifies the date of its recording, a running number for all texts recorded during one day, and a code for the type of text recorded. This is illustrated with the record number 080919-007-CvNP: 080919 stands for “2008, September 19”; 007 stands for “\isi{recorded text} #7 of that day”; and CvNP stands for “Personal Narrative (NP) which occurred during a Conversation (Cv)”. The same record numbers are used for the examples given in this book (see ‘Conventions for examples‘, p. \pageref{Para_0}) and the transcribed texts presented in Appendix \ref{Para_A}.
